bibl.title: Edward Crofery v. O. D. Butterfield. Order Granting Writ
bibl.note: Our transcription is based on a digital image of the microfilmed original.

div1.p: In the District Court Third Judicial District within and for the County of King and Territory of Washington holding terms at Seattle in said County and Territory
In the Matter of the Application of Edward Crofery for a writ of Habeas Cropus Order Granting Writ

Upon reading and filing the petition of Edward Crogery duly signed and verified by him wherby it appears that Edward Crofery is illegally imprisoned and retrained of his liberty by Butterfield Chief of police of the City of Seattle at the City Jail in the City of Seattle in the County of King and Territory of Washington and stating wherein the alleged illegality consists from which it appears to me that a writ of Habeas Corpus oaught to issue, it is ordered that a writ of Habeas Corpus issue out of and under the seal of the District Court within and for said county of King and Territory of Washington directed to the said O. D. Butterfield Chief of Police - as

aforesaid commanding him to have the body of the said Edward Crofery before me in the Court room of the said Court at the County of King forthwith on the 11th day of May A.D. 1889 at 10 O'cloc in the fore of said day to do and receive what shall then and there be considered concerning the said Edward Crogery together with the time and cause of his detention and that you have then and there the said writ. C. H. Hanford Judge of the District Court.

R-324 6775
In the Matter of the Petition of Edward Crofery for writ of Habeas Corpus
Order
FILED MAY 11 1889 R M Hopkins Clerk. By. H T Harmon Deputy Clerk.
